Does the solution \\( x(t) \\) to the differential equation \\( \dot{x} = Dx + z(t) \\) depend nonlinearly on \\( \omega \\) if \\( z(t) = e^{i\omega t} \\) is used as the input and no other changes are made to the system?
Explanation: The solution to the differential equation is significantly affected by \\( \omega \\) because \\( z(t) = e^{i\omega t} \\) contributes a complex exponential component that introduces oscillatory behavior into the system dynamics, which interacts nonlinearly with the matrix D.
